page.title: 06Employment in March
page.content: We made a{survey of the working {parents}of our three{third year {classes.}Results from it showed that one third of them went out of{March}to work,many were{employed}by{Fenland {Hal,}few worked on{farms}or{railway. {Factories}were planned to make jobs. {Fenland's deputy chief planning {officer}invited us to see how the {planning committee}operated in{Fenland {Hall.}We became the{"planning {committee"}for an afternoon. 'I was vice chairman for the{committee.}It was very comfortable sitting up high in his seat.My job was{counting}the "no"votes. The room looked like a court. We had to decide whether an applicant could go ahead with his plans. There were many{applicants. {Some asked to build houses}or {factories}and one asked to place a {picnic area'. }Nicola Styles.
